summary: Control engineer with undergraduate studies in electrical engineering. Passionate about research and development, with strong theoretical and practical background in control systems, analytical skills and team-working spirit. Looking forward to start my career and put my knowledge into practice.

projects.title: Diploma Thesis: "Extended Object Tracking of Pedestrians in Automotive Applications"
projects.description:
Design and development of an extended object tracking algorithm for a single pedestrian, walking in the area of a stationary vehicle, based on obtained LIDAR and Mono Camera sensor data during a real automotive scenario. 

Aim: Achieve accurate estimation of both the kinematic attributes of the pedestrian (2D centroid position/velocity), as well as his shape extent in x-y plane.

Tools: MATLAB, PreScan software, OpenPose library

Tasks:
• Conducted an extensive research in existing literature concerning state-of-the-art extended object tracking algorithms, focusing mainly on pedestrian tracking for automotive applications.
• Designed different automotive scenarios for (LIDAR and Camera) sensor data acquisition in PreScan software.
• Developed a tracking algorithm for a single pedestrian (in MATLAB) involving sensor fusion of LIDAR-obtained pedestrian point cloud data and Camera-obtained human pose detections of pedestrian's shoulders and ankles. The OpenPose library was used to obtain the corresponding human pose detections.
• The project took place in the Cognitive Robotics department, TU Delft.

projects.title: Robotics Practical Assignment
projects.description:
Development of a control/navigation algorithm for autonomous driving of a virtual car in a virtual test track, run in Gazebo simulator.

Aim: The virtual car can autonomously navigate in the virtual environment while avoiding surrounding obstacles and humans.

Tools: Linux, C++, ROS, OpenCV, PCL.

Tasks:
• Set communication between different ROS nodes.
• Implemented a human detection algorithm based on obtained camera images using OpenCV.
• Implemented an obstacle detection algorithm based on laser point cloud data using PCL.
• Implemented a control algorithm for throttle/break and steering actions of the virtual car based on obtained human/obstacle detections.

projects.title: Diploma Thesis: "Development and Supervisory Control of a Wireless Sensors and Controllers Network"
projects.description:
Development of a wireless network consisting of sensors measuring outdoor/indoor temperature, relative humidity, pneumatics’ network pressure, RMS current, distance and weight, as well as Programmable Logical Controllers (PLCs) in the Systems & Measurements laboratory. 

Aim: Create a laboratory-scaled sensor network setup resembling as closely as possible a real sensor/actuator industrial network setup.

Tools: X-CTU software, SIMATIC Manager

Tasks:
• Conducted independently an extensive market search in order to select the hardware components fulfilling the requirements set, within specific budget limitations.
• Performed XBee RF modules communication programming using X-CTU software, PLC networking/programming using SIMATIC Manager. 
• Provided documentation containing the development steps and instructions on using and expanding the network by adding nodes, if desired in the future.
• The setup was planned to be used in terms of an laboratory-based undergraduate industrial automation course in Electrical & Computer Engineering department of University of Patras.

publications.name: A Wireless Sensors and Controllers Network in Automation - A Laboratory-Scale Implementation for Students Training
publications.publisher: MED'14, the 22nd Mediterranean Conference on Control & Automation, Palermo, Italy

profile_positions.description:
Title: "Extended Object Tracking of pedestrians in automotive applications"

Design and development of an extended object tracking algorithm for a single pedestrian, walking in the area of a stationary vehicle, based on obtained LIDAR and Mono Camera sensor data during a real automotive scenario.

Aim: Achieve accurate estimation of both the kinematic attributes of the pedestrian (2D centroid position/velocity), as well as his shape extent in x-y plane.

Tools: MATLAB, PreScan software, OpenPose library

Tasks:
• Conducted an extensive research in existing literature concerning state-of-the-art extended object tracking algorithms, focusing mainly on pedestrian tracking for automotive applications.
• Designed different automotive scenarios for (LIDAR and Camera) sensor data acquisition in PreScan software.
• Developed a tracking algorithm for a single pedestrian (in MATLAB) involving sensor fusion of LIDAR-obtained pedestrian point cloud data and Camera-obtained human pose detections of pedestrian's shoulders and ankles. The OpenPose library was used to obtain the corresponding human pose detections.

profile_positions.title: Diploma Thesis Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Investigation of track synchronization and track association/fusion issues for a distributed fusion architecture scheme considered for autonomous driving of the TU Delft vehicle (Toyota Prius).

Aim: Design parts of the fusion center of an autonomous vehicle.

Tools: MATLAB, PreScan software

Tasks:
• Designed an automotive simulation scenario for (LIDAR) sensor data acquisition in PreScan software.
• Designed a synchronization strategy for target tracks in a distributed fusion architecture scheme.
• Implemented a fusion algorithm performing track-to-track association/fusion of LIDAR-detected targets/objects surrounding the vehicle.
• Compared different fusion strategies by running Monte Carlo simulations and proposed the most appropriate to be implemented on the vehicle.
profile_positions.title: Modelling & Simulation Intern

profile_positions.description:
Implementation of a supervisory control scheme for a wireless networks of sensors and programmable logic controllers (PLCs) in the Systems & Measurements laboratory.

Aim: Create a laboratory-scaled sensor network setup resembling as closely as possible a real sensor/actuator industrial network setup.

Tools: SIMATIC Manager, WinCC Flexible software

Tasks:
• Designed a SCADA system for supervision using WinCC Flexible software. By this way, sensor readings are transferred via the network of PLCs and are finally demonstrated in a monitor mounted on a designated spot of the laboratory.
• Provided documentation containing the development steps and instructions on using and expanding the network by adding nodes, if desired in the future.
• A paper describing the integration methodology and the use of the setup in a laboratory-based undergraduate course was published at the 22nd Mediterranean Conference on Control and Automation in Palermo, Italy under the title "A Wireless Sensors and Controllers Network in Automation: A Laboratory-Scale implementation for Students Training".
profile_positions.title: Control & Automation Intern
